item.title: Google realted notes
item.description: How to create a google account without gmail https://accounts.google.com/SignUpWithoutGmail https://accounts.google.com/signup/v2/webcreateaccount?flowName=GlifWebSignIn&flowEntry=SignUp&nogm=true

item.title: Restic
item.description: setup and backup 1 - install restic 2 - create repo for restic to store backups in 1 restic init --repo /path/to/storage 3 - manual backup 1 restic --repo /path/to/storage backup /path/to/what/to/backup 4 - automate based on time interval we can use cron here, but for unattended part of this to work we need to pass repo password

item.title: YAML
item.description: putting schema on top on yaml file makes yaml lsp use that schema eg: yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/goformation/master/schema/cloudformation.schema.json for AWS

item.title: Docker
item.description: code snippets adding a user to docker container

item.title: PC peripherals
item.description: getting custom rom on one-plus root: search in devices https://twrp.me/Devices/ https://twrp.me/oneplus/oneplus7tpro.html first problem: phone is in factory reset protection state so i have to access gmail account -> solution press power button till selection menu appears select emergency -> select add new contact -> deny access -> go to settings -> select permissions -> search for chrome -> search app or setting -> setting(app info)-> setting’s app info -> open -> addiotional settings -> backup and reset-> factory reset

item.title: Cuda
item.description: Prepare machine for ml with cuda stack cuda: get nvidia drivers for the highest version CUDA we want to install 1 - pick latest version from this list 2 - go through selection and you will be given the installation instructions for deb or run files ex deb file link: https://developer.

item.title: tensorflow
item.description: find out dependancies for cuda under install section https://www.tensorflow.org/install ex: for tensorflow 2.9.0 cudatoolkit=11.2 cudnn=8.1.0

item.title: feh
item.description: for auto reloading images on file changes use option –auto-reload note: option must be enabled at compile time. make app=1 exif=1 inotify=1 help=1 sudo make app=1 exif=1 inotify=1 help=1

item.title: Git
item.description: Deleting a branch after a pull request is merged Assuming we are working with a remote tracking branch called testing

item.title: Inotify
item.description: Inotify Basics Watch for changes recursively Auto git commit inotifywait –quiet –monitor –event CLOSE_WRITE –format “git commit –message ‘autocommit on change’ %w” file.

item.title: Kodi

item.title: Samba
item.description: samba setup on ubuntu app samba files: /etc/samba/smb.conf sample sbm.conf in private bin 1 2 # install samba sudo apt install samba load changes

item.title: Setup SSH on new machine
item.description: REMOTE DEVICE commands for ubuntu prerequisites: openssh-server, ufw ubuntu ship with ufw NOTE: if on vps without dedicated ipV4, enable IPV6 for ufw set IPV6=yes in /etc/default/ufw

item.title: ufw
item.description: settings allow IPV6 set IPV6=yes in /etc/default/ufw adding rules 1 2 3 4 5 # using application profile, for ex. sudo ufw allow OpenSSH # OR using rules in /etc/services sudo ufw allow ssh

item.description: Preparing Video files for roku media player on tcl Supported media file types Different Roku devices support different formats. Newer firmware may support additional formats.

item.title: Getting Subtitles
item.description: use find and subliminal find -name “*.mkv” -type f -print0 | xargs -0 subliminal –debug –opensubtitles ‘wannabeengineer’ ‘8Lz$s@ic6ebU7x’ download –provider “opensubtitles” –max-workers 8 -l en

item.title: Git mistakes
item.description: Shouldn’t need them but WILL Delete everything and start a fresh master branch git checkout –orphan tmp-master # create a temporary branch git rm -r –cached git add .

item.title: Keyboard
item.description: non-persistent way to swap capslock and ctrl under X via setxkbmap set: setxkbmap -option “ctrl:swapcaps” reset: setxkbmap -option

item.title: Publishing obsidian notes
item.description: Convert the notes to standard markdown for this we can use obsidian-export make sure to set obsidian link preps://github.coferance to relative path convert to html for this we can use hugo with templates and do it from scrach.
